questions.question: Which car or cars have the position for a right turn on this one-way street?
choices: The car in the extreme right lane (marked A)
Any of the cars in the two upper lanes (marked A and B).
The car in the extreme left lane (marked D)

questions.question: When you see a truck preparing for a right turn ahead, you should:
choices: Stay behind
Pass on the left
Pass on the right before the truck has completed the turn

questions.question: The law requires a person that is 16 years to wear a safety belt:
choices: When sitting in either the front or back seat
Only when sitting in the back seat
Only when sitting in the front seat

questions.question: When a vehicle comes toward you at night, at what distance must you dim your headlights?
choices: 400 feet
500 feet
200 feet

questions.question: When you plan to exit an expressway, you should:
choices: Drive faster than expressway traffic to find a gap in your exit lane
Not use your turn signal until you exit
Start slowing down in the deceleration lane

questions.question: To better prepare for the constant decisions necessary for safe, defensive driving, you must:
choices: Know what is happening around your vehicle
Drive at least 10 mph below the posted speed limit
Follow other vehicles closely

questions.question: A school bus ahead of you displays yellow flashing lights at the top. It means:
choices: You should try to pass as soon as possible
The bus is about to stop
You must come to complete stop

questions.question: When approaching a stopped emergency vehicle with activated lights on a multi-lane roadway, you must:
choices: Vacate the lane closest to the emergency vehicle, if safe to do so
Keep your speed and avoid stopping
Turn on your headlights

questions.question: A condition known as highway hypnosis is often brought on by:
choices: Warning signs in work zones
Monotony
Heavy city traffic

questions.question: Do not enter a railroad crossing, if:
choices: The crossing is marked with a crossbuck sign
You cannot see the tracks for 500 feet in both directions
You cannot drive completely through without stopping on tracks

questions.question: Unless otherwise posted, the general maximum speed limit on a rural interstate is:
choices: 75 mph
65 mph
70 mph

questions.question: A HAWK signal is showing alternating flashing red lights. What will follow next?
choices: A steady yellow light
A steady red light
A deactivated (dark) signal

questions.question: If two vehicles reach an intersection with 4-way stops at approximately the same time:
choices: The vehicle that accelerate faster should go first
The vehicle on the right should yield to the vehicle on the left
The vehicle on the left should yield to the vehicle on the right

questions.question: If it feels like your tires have lost traction with the surface of the road, you should:
choices: Keep speed and go straight
Ease your foot off the gas pedal
Brake and turn off the road

questions.question: Unless there is an emergency, it is illegal to use a cell phone for text messaging while driving:
choices: False
True

questions.question: Which is the most crucial driving technique on icy or snowy roads?
choices: Use a higher gear
Add extra weight to the vehicle to improve traction
Reduce speed and increase following distance

questions.question: The road edge on the right side is marked by a:
choices: Solid white line
Broken white line
Solid yellow line

questions.question: At a fire hydrant, parking and leaving your car is not allowed:
choices: Within 30 feet
Within 15 feet
Within 20 feet

questions.question: After violating the Hands-Free GA Law, a driver will accumulate at least one point on their record.
choices: False
True

questions.question: If you strike an unattended vehicle and cannot find the owner, you must:
choices: Call a lawyer
Return to the scene later
Leave a note that identifies you as the person who hit the vehicle

questions.question: You are stopped with your engine on and feel symptoms like dizziness, nausea, and headache. What is the best thing to do?
choices: Turn on emergency flashers, lock your car and rest with windows closed
Stop your engine and open the windows
Immediately drive to a garage

questions.question: What do the light gray areas in the picture mark?
choices: Blind spot
Passing zone
Safety maneuver angle

questions.question: During foggy weather, a driver should turn on the vehicle's high-beam headlights to increase the field of vision.
choices: False
True

questions.question: You see this sign on a vehicle ahead. It means:
choices: The vehicle is carrying a load that is potentially dangerous
The vehicle is moving slower than normal traffic
The vehicle is wider than normal

questions.question: Once you have entered an intersection to make a left turn, and it is safe, you should move to the right lane on the street you are turning onto.
choices: True
False

questions.question: Georgia state law prohibits all drivers from using a cell or mobile phone while driving.
choices: True
False

questions.question: Parking a car in a bicycle lane is allowed:
choices: If between 10 p.m. and 6 a.m
If more than 200 feet from a no-parking sign
Under no circumstances

questions.question: A pedestrian is crossing your lane at an intersection, but there is no marked crosswalk. You should:
choices: Stop and let the pedestrian cross
Make the pedestrian aware that he is not using a marked crosswalk
Carefully drive around the pedestrian

questions.question: Which of the following must you obey over the other two?
choices: A flashing red light
A stop sign
A flagger

questions.question: To avoid getting tired on a long trip, you should:
choices: Keep your eyes still
Turn off radio and avoid other sounds
Stop and take regular breaks

questions.question: Passing another vehicle by driving on the left side on a two-lane road is not allowed:
choices: On one-way streets
Where the posted speed limit is 30 mph or less
Within 100 feet of a tunnel

questions.question: When may you drive at the maximum speed indicated by a speed limit sign?
choices: When conditions permit you to drive at such a speed safely
Only in the daytime
Only on divided highways, or highways designed for one-way traffic

questions.question: Rubbing tires against a curb might help in which situation?
choices: When running off the pavement
When brakes fail
When headlights fail

questions.question: When a traffic signal is showing a flashing red light, you must:
choices: Stop completely and remain stopped until a green signal appears
Stop completely, only proceed when you can do so safely
Proceed as normal, crossing traffic must always stop

questions.question: What is the safest thing to do if a heavy fog is on the road?
choices: Slow down and turn on hazard lights
Drive slowly with parking lights on
Pull over into a parking area and stop driving

questions.question: You may drive across a gore area bounded by solid white lines:
choices: In no situation
To make a left turn into an alley, private road, or driveway
To pass slower vehicles

questions.question: With an instructional permit, you may drive alone:
choices: Any time, except between 11:00 p.m. and 5:00 a.m
In no situation
To a license office for the purpose of taking a test

questions.question: When approaching a stopped school bus with flashing red lights traveling on your side of a divided highway, you must:
choices: Stop only if children are crossing the street
Stop
Pass as quickly as possible

questions.question: If you are involved in a traffic crash, you must always:
choices: File an accident report with Georgia Department of Driver Services
Immediately move injured people out of the traffic lane
Stop at the scene.

questions.question: When passing a motorcycle driving in your lane, you must:
choices: Share the same lane only if the speed limit is 35 mph or less
Keep no more than three feet between your car and the motorcycle
Signal and change lanes completely

questions.question: What is true about bald or badly worn tires?
choices: They save money in fuel consumption
They help to avoid skids on gravel roads
They increase the chance of hydroplaning on wet road surfaces

questions.question: When must you use your headlights?
choices: A half-hour after sunrise
Any time in open country with a clear road ahead
When it is snowing heavily

questions.question: Which is true about excessive speed at night?
choices: It is more dangerous because of limited visibility
It is less dangerous because of limited traffic
It is less dangerous because you tend to more alert

questions.question: You should never make a U-turn:
choices: Before a curve where you cannot be seen for a great distance
In front of a police station
On a two-way road

questions.question: If you have a tire blowout, you should:
choices: Let the car slow to a low speed or a stop
Allow the steering wheel to move freely
Brake hard to bring your car to an immediate stop

questions.question: On a multi-lane, two-way highway, you must never drive to the left of the center line except:
choices: When there is a broken white line on your right
When making a left turn
When passing slower vehicles

questions.question: Who should have the right-of-way at a roundabout?
choices: Any driver approaching from the right
A driver entering the roundabout
A driver already in the roundabout

questions.question: If you feel drowsy on a long trip, you should:
choices: Drive faster
Turn off radio and avoid other sounds
Pull off the road and rest

questions.question: When a traffic signal is showing a flashing yellow light, you must:
choices: Stop and proceed when you can do so safely
Slow down and be especially alert
Proceed as normal, crossing traffic must always stop

questions.question: Which of the following increases the risk of carbon monoxide poisoning?
choices: Driving too fast for conditions
Keeping an unsafe following distance on high-speed roadways
Running the motor in a closed garage

questions.question: The law allows parking in all of the following places except:
choices: 25 feet from a fire hydrant
On a hill
Within 30 feet of a stop sign

questions.question: A conviction of aggressive driving will result in the following number of points on your driving record:
choices: Six points
Four points
Three points

questions.question: If you are unable to drive at a posted minimum speed under normal driving conditions, you should:
choices: Drive on the shoulder
Keep as far to the right as possible
Seek an alternate route

questions.question: When required to stop at a railroad crossing, you must stop and keep this distance from the nearest rail:
choices: No more than 15 feet
No closer than 15 feet and no more than 50 feet
No closer than 50 feet

questions.question: How is driving affected by acute marijuana use?
choices: It improves night vision
It impairs driving by affecting critical thinking and motor skills
It makes it easier for a driver to stay alert on long trips

questions.question: When a traffic officer is directing you to drive against a red light, you should:
choices: Drive against the red light
Obey existing signs and signals
Wait for verbal directions

questions.question: You may continue carefully against a yellow light if:
choices: There is an emergency vehicle crossing your lane
You cannot stop safely
There are no pedestrians crossing

questions.question: Which of the following is generally illegal when driving on an expressway?
choices: Keeping to the right when driving slower than other vehicles
Stopping
Going to the next exit when you miss your exit

questions.question: Which is one factor that significantly affects your stopping distance?
choices: Type and condition of the pavement
Steering ability
Posted speed limit

questions.question: When a school bus with flashing red lights stops on the other side of a highway divided by a median, you should:
choices: Proceed with caution
Always stop
Stop only when the bus has stopped in a loading zone.

questions.question: In lanes separated by white lines:
choices: Traffic flows in one direction only
Crossing the white lines is prohibited
Traffic flows in two (opposite) directions

questions.question: When driving in foggy conditions, high beams will:
choices: Reduce glare
Make it more difficult to see
Improve your ability to see ahead

questions.question: When driving near a pedestrian who is carrying a white cane and using a guide dog, you must:
choices: Slow down and be prepared to stop
Proceed normally
Honk your horn

questions.question: Hitting the ground from a four-story building has the same force of impact as striking something at:
choices: 10 mph
40 mph
60 mph

questions.question: The following practices are dangerous while driving. Which is also always illegal?
choices: Using your cell phone with hands-free devices
Having an unrestrained dog inside the car
Listening to music through headphones that cover both ears

questions.question: The blood alcohol concentration (BAC) level at which it is illegal for any person under 21 years to drive is:
choices: 0.08 percent
0.06 percent
0.02 percent

questions.question: You have just gone through deep water. What is the first thing you should do?
choices: Check your exhaust
Turn on your headlights
Test your brakes

questions.question: A class D driver's license:
choices: Is a non-commercial license for drivers age 18 and older
Is a provisional license issued to drivers ages 16 and 17
Is a non-commercial license for drivers who operate commercial motor vehicles

questions.question: This picture illustrates:
choices: Correct turns
A proper right turn, but a wrong left turn
Drivers turning into wrong lanes

questions.question: If bad weather makes it hard for you to see, you should:
choices: Speed up to get off the road quickly
Increase your following distance
Drive in the lane closest to oncoming traffic

questions.question: Night driving is more dangerous than daytime driving because:
choices: It is harder to see at night
Drivers tend to be more alert at night
There is less traffic at night
All of the above

questions.question: After a train has passed a railroad crossing with more than one track, you should:
choices: Pass the first track and stop before crossing the second
Wait until you are sure all tracks are clear
Move forward as soon as the train passes
